meanings.definition: Make (a boat) watertight by filling the seams with a waterproof material.
meanings.sent1: He caulks the boat to keep water out.
meanings.sent2: The sailor caulks the ship before setting sail.
meanings.sent3: Why did the boat refuse to sink? Because it was expertly caulked!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to caulk every seam of the boat was like sealing away her worries.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the caulking hammer echoed across the harbor, ensuring a dry voyage.

meanings.definition: A waterproof filler and sealant, used in building work and repairs.
meanings.sent1: The builder applied caulks to the gaps in the wall.
meanings.sent2: She bought a tube of caulks for the bathroom renovation.
meanings.sent3: The caulks in the toolbox were always ready for action.
meanings.sent4: His trusty caulks were like magic, sealing leaks with ease.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh caulks filled the room, promising a leak-free finish.
